Catalogue.Description: These kits help you establish good foundations in an AWS Account. They include basic security and compliance tools, cost controls and network setup.

Kits.Name: VPC with NAT
Kits.Description:
This stack creates and Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) in the target account. A VPC is a pre-requisite for a range of other services you may want to create in this account, eg EC2 instances must be created in a VPC.
This VPC will create 3 public subnets and 3 private subnets. The public subnets will be accessible from the Internet via an Internet Gateway.
NAT Gateways enable outbound access to the Internet from the private subnets - add more than one to have multi-AZ resilience for NAT.
Kits.MoreInfo: This kit is supplied by AWS. Visit the Amazon AWS site.

Kits.Name: Single EC2 instance
Kits.Description: A kit to create a single server instance. Each unique server name you specify will be created in its own CloudFormation stack. You can create instances using either x86 or Arm processors, with Windows, Amazon Linux or Ubuntu AWS-managed AMIs. You can customise the Userdata that will be run when the instance is brought online - by default the supplied script will install a web server as well as utilities to enable the instance to be accessed via the AWS console.

Kits.Name: AWS Backup
Kits.Description: This kit creates a AWS Backup Vault and sets up backup plans that will automatically back up resources you tag in your account. It offers 6 different backup plans that can be applied to resources in your account based on Tags.
